projects.name: Support to the Rule of Law and Fundamental Rights Sector in Montenegro - Application of Unique Information System of Judiciary
projects.description: Application of the Unique Information System of the Judiciary, covering the needs and critical business processes of the Ministry of Justice, the Judicial Council, the courts, the State Prosecutor's Office and the Institute for Enforcement of Criminal Sanctions.
projects.outcome: 4.1. Rule of law and justice for all

projects.name: Development of e-services and digital infrastructure as COVID-19 response measure
projects.description: Strengthening of the current government infrastructure, human resources, key national shared digital platforms, raising awareness of citizens and the business sector on the benefits of digital transformations and development of e-services to their preferences in order to facilitate cooperation with the administration and to ensure further improvements in secure public service delivery.

projects.name: Improving capacities for integrated climate-resilient flood risk management (FRM) and enhancing resilience of vulnerable communities in Drin River Basin in Montenegro, Albania and North Macedonia
projects.description: The main outcomes of the project are: i) Improved climate risk knowledge and tools for forecasting and floods prevention; ii) strengthened bilateral and regional cooperation for FRM, including EU acquis requirement and iii) structural and non-structural FRM interventions implemented.

projects.name: Developing Facilities for Provision of Social Services
projects.description: Enabling socially vulnerable groups improved access to quality, equitable, inclusive and sustainable social services.

projects.name: Individual Measure to Strenghten Integrated Border Management Capacities in Montenegro
projects.description: a) Strengthening technical capacities for border surveillance;                      b) Strengthening technical capacities to implement an EU-compliant identification and registration system;                                                           c)  Enhancing infrastructure at key border crossing points;                                 d) Construction of Montenegrin National Coordination Centre building;           e) Strengthening capacities of border management stakeholders to better impleme
projects.outcome: 4.1. Rule of law and justice for all

projects.name: Improved protection from health emergencies
projects.description: Strengthened IRH capacity for emergency preparedness; PHEOC - Establishing Public Health Emergency Operating Centre;  Strengthening essential emergency medical services.

projects.name: ReLOaD2 - Strengthening partnerships between local governments, civil society and youth in the Montenegro by scaling-up a successful model ((implemented in ReLOaD1) of transparent and project-based fu
projects.description: Regional Assessment of existing in-country mechanisms for disbursement of public funds to CSOs developed; Assessment of existing (budgets) mechanisms for disbursement of public funds to CSOs for each selected local government developed (for new ReLOaD2 municipalities); Methodology and accompanying tools, as well as monitoring framework for funding of CSOs discussed and formalized; Research and Assessment of local youth policies for all participating municipalities finalized and joint trainings f

projects.name: Fostering social cohesion through empowering and engaging children and youth to participate in developing child-centered policies (Joint PBF program)
projects.description:
Joint UN Project: Enhancing citizens’ trust in institutions and building resilient communities, UNICEF component, including:
1. Support children, adolescents, and youth, including through youth organizations and CSOs, to contribute to local and national dialogues and Local and national Social Cohesion Pledges as active citizens and agents of social cohesion. 
2. Enhance the skills, capacities and resilience of children, adolescents, parents/caregivers, and teachers through civic education progra

projects.name: Improving transboundary groundwater governance and sustainability of related ecosystems
projects.description:
The Strategic Action Program (SAP) is focused to achieve joint sustainable and equitable use and protection of Dinaric karst aquifer system.

projects.name: Adaptation to climate change and resilience in the Montenegrin mountain areas-GORA
projects.description:
Goal. Enhance ecosystem and smallholder livelihood resilience to climate change in northern
Montenegro through the adoption of environmentally sustainable and climate resilient technologies
and practices.
Objective. The project objective is reduce the vulnerability of livelihoods & ecosystems in
northern Montenegro to the negative impacts of climate change.
Outcomes. The project will achieve the stated goal and objective through three outcomes:
• Outcome 1. Enhanced resilience of smallholders’ l

projects.name: Supporting initiatives for Low-carbon development and transport
projects.description:
a) Support studies (safeguards, legal assessment, gender) for the preparation of the project "Low-carbon and Climate Resilient Bus Transport for the City of Podgorica and its Neighbouring Towns"
b) Feasibility studies for the preparation of the full project proposal for the project "Low-carbon and Climate Resilient Bus Transport for the City of Podgorica and its Neighbouring Towns"

projects.name: Enhancing citizens’ trust in institutions and building resilient communities (Joint PBF project)
projects.description: The UNDP component of the Joint UN Programme aims to foster trust in institutions and build resilient communities by enhancing social cohesion and promoting gender equality. It emphasizes the empowerment of both women and men, particularly younger generations, to engage in meaningful civic activities that protect human rights and advance social cohesion. Key activities include organizing local dialogues in five communities to address trust issues, divisive narratives, and social cohesion, and de

projects.name: Supporting authorities to improve management planning of key biodiversity areas
projects.description:
Within the Programme ‚‚Biodiversity Mainstreaming into Sectoral Policies and Strengthened Protection of Biodiversity Hot-spots in Montenegro", a large number of expert studies and analyzes will be prepared in support of improved management of key areas of biodiversity through capacity building and integration of biodiversity conservation goals in the tourism, spatial planning, forestry and agriculture sectors.
During 2023, the focus will be on the improvement of protection studies, the strengthe
projects.outcome: 1.3 Management of  infrastructure, cultural and natural resources

projects.name: Support to Ministry of Education, Science, and Innovation, other central institutions and schools, to implement strategic interventions at improving access, quality and inclusiveness of education, inc
projects.description: Support to design, implementation, and monitoring of programmatic interventions aimed at improving the quality and inclusiveness of education, with particular focus on children from most vulnerable groups in ECE and the fist cycle of elementary school; also, support to implementation of skills development program, with focus on social and emotional development of children and adolescents to improve their resilience

projects.name: Improved performance of the rule of law institutions regarding handling of war crimes cases (EU support to Confidence Building)
projects.description: The project will step up the provision of expertise and support to better equip judicial and law enforcement authorities in handling war crimes cases at the domestic level, improve the conditions for regional (cross-jurisdictional/cross-boundary) cooperation in processing these cases, enhance the delivery of support services to victims and witnesses and strengthen the capacity of relevant actors in victim support, which would all enhance efficient and effective victim-centred and human rights-ba
projects.outcome: 4.1. Rule of law and justice for all

projects.name: Improving overall forensic capacities in Montenegro (CSI and Forensic Center) to provide evidence and intelligence necessary for investigating and processing FAE-related crime and SGBV on the national
projects.description: Improving the diversity of CSI and forensic laboratory practices, by introducing contemporary internationally standardized and laboratory-developed methods and enabling implementation of contemporary forensic methods by further modernizing forensic equipment and providing needed training for the forensic staff.
projects.outcome: 4.1. Rule of law and justice for all

projects.name: E-Social: Leveraging Digital Solutions to Enable Efficient Social Protection of the Vulnerable
projects.description:
UNDP has supported the Government of Montenegro in establishing the national Integrated Social Welfare Information System (e-Social IS), which has been in operation since January 2015. Being the backbone of the country's social protection system, e-Social is in charge of processing nearly all social protection entitlements. 

To provide timely and efficiently cash transfers and social services and to ensure that new legislative solutions are duly enforced, it is necessary to continuously invest

projects.name: Drafting of National Adaptation Plan
projects.description: Update the mission and mandate of the National Council for Sustainable Development and its Working Group on Mitigation and Adaptation to Climate Change in order to appropriately include issues related to just resilience and adaptation to climate change in order to enhance action, coordination, and accountability. Undertake a comprehensive review and consolidation of available climate risks assessments within or related to the four priority sectors (water, agriculture, helth, tourism) . Develop g

projects.name: Strengthening Health System in Montenegro through the digitalization of the health sector
projects.description: Improvement of the Integrated Health Information System (IHIS), in order to achieve full improvement of the IT infrastructure in the health sector and facilitate centralized and timely management and use of reliable data for strategic decision-making.

projects.name: Technical and expert support to the Administrative Court of Montenegro, Bar Association and Ombudsperson to work with asylum seekers, refugees and stateless persons/persons at risk of statelessness
projects.description: The Administrative Court of Montenegro is the 2nd instance institution in the asylum procedures and the 3rd instance institution in the statelessness determination procedure. Work with asylum seekers, refugees and stateless persons/persons at risk of statelessness pose different challenges to the court: from interpretation services, to more specific knowledge on different topics (country of origin information, unaccompanied and separated children, family reunification cases, credibility assessme
projects.outcome: 4.1. Rule of law and justice for all

projects.name: Strengthen competencies in Media and Information Literacy to bolster resilience against negative narratives within the education system, promote solution journalism and foster cultural diversity (Join
projects.description:
Joint UN Project: Enhancing citizens’ trust in institutions and building resilient communities, UNESCO component, including:
•	Implement a comprehensive Media and Information Literacy concept in elementary and secondary schools is accompanied by establishment of a Resource Centre for Media and Information Literacy within the public university. Additionally, provide support for academia-facilitated thematic dialogue platforms, fostering interaction between students and diverse social actors, incl

projects.name: Capacity Development of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
projects.description: The overall objective the Engagement Facility is to support capacity development of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Montenegro. The Engagement Facility 2024-2027 will be implemented under the Direct Implementation Modality, through an agreed set of initiatives agreed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Montenegro and UNDP and in line with the committed strategic priorities in the UNDP’s Country Programme for 2023-2027.

projects.name: Enhancing capacities for gender mainstreaming in the work of the Government - United in Gender Equality
projects.description: This upcoming Action has been designed to contribute to the enhance capacities to promote gender equality and introduce gender mainstreaming in the work of the Government offering technical assistance and addressing specific needs. Action is designed to collect evidence, analyze perceptions, policies and practices, including the role and position of existing gender equality infrastructure. Action will enhance capacities for gender mainstreaming in strategic framework and state programmes and dev

projects.name: Western Balkans Readmission Capacity Building (WBCAP) & Western Balkans Integrated Border Management Capacity Building (WBIBM)
projects.description:
Key program components include:  
a) Improved procedures in the context of mixed migration in Montenegro contributes to the harmonization of the border management system with EU standards, 
b) Strengthened operational capacities of the Border Police for the fight against cross-border crime affect the mitigation of challenges regarding the security of Montenegrin borders, 
c) Improved dialogue and cooperation in the field of readmission between Montenegro and countries of origin contribute to the

projects.name: Fostering intercultural dialogue by enhancing the cultural and creative sectors for increased socio-economic impact
projects.description: Improving the performance of the cultural and creative sectors (cultural and creative organisations, businesses and individual professionals) in order to enhance skills, knowledge, access to financial aid to increase competitiveness and sustain co-production and circulation of goods and services
projects.outcome: 1.1.Private sector growth, economic transformation and decent jobs

projects.name: Ensure that refugee women, men, boys and girls of diverse backgrounds are able to engage meaningfully and are consulted on access to rights, assistance, and solutions through the activities aimed at i
projects.description:
Refugees come to Montenegro with a variety skills, knowledge, expertise and assets. As much has 40% of adult refugees have university diploma. Among holders of temporary protection, there are over 80% of university graduates or above. Some 16% of refugees set up their business in Montenegro (with 67% of entrepreneurs being women) with much more that are interested in it. 
In 2024, the UNHCR worked with refugee communities to unlock their potential by creating various opportunities and support ch

projects.name: Design and implement capacity building measures for enhancing protection of cultural heritage and fighting illicit trafficking of cultural property
projects.description: Foster intra-regional cooperation, dialogue, mutual respect and recognition among communities, contributing to an enabling environment for reconciliation, stability and sustainable development, by means of reinforcing the protection of cultural heritage and cultural diversity, by reducing illicit trafficking of cultural properties, through enhancement capacities, knowledge and skills of key institutional partners.

projects.name: Strengthen routine immunization system including through improved vaccine management
projects.description: Linked to activities aimed at improving immunization coverages among children including capacity building of health workers and improved vaccine management

projects.name: Advocacy and technical support to the MSWFCD and other institutions in strengthening social service workforce capacities to prevent violence, family child separation, foster care
projects.description: Support will include activities related to capacity building of social service workforce and equipping day care centers for universal, culturally sensitive prevention, outreach, mental health and psychosocial support with special emphasis on the work with Roma and Egyptian families, families with children with disabilities, migrant and refugee children.

projects.name: Technical and expert support to the Ministry of the Interior to conduct asylum and statelessness related procedures in line with international standards
projects.description: Montenegro has been an EU candidate country since November 2010. Although a front-runner in the EU accession process, with national human rights guarantees generally aligned, additional work is needed to strengthen the institutional capacity, including the effective implementation of policies, legislation and improved accountability, oversight, and coordination.

projects.name: Technical and expert support to line institutions to conduct procedures with asylum seekers, refugees and persons at risk of statelessness/statelessness persons in a protection sensitive and efficient
projects.description: Although the legislative and institutional framework of Montenegro is largely in place to secure respect of fundamental human rights additional efforts are needed to secure implementation of rights foreseen by the national legislation and international treaties. This is particularly visible on work with asylum seekers, refugees and persons at risk of statelessness/stateless persons as many of these people do not speak Montenegrin language and have ties with countries other than Montenegro.

projects.name: Enhancing Migration Response and Service Delivery in Montenegro
projects.description: The objective of the Action is to strengthen operational and technical capacities at the Božaj Reception Centre, improving service delivery through Mobile Team (provision of direct assistance/NFIs and psychosocial support to migrants, expanded transport and translation services, and upgrading WASH infrastructure) and enhancing data collection and analysis on mixed migration flows (insights from data collected contributing to evidence-based migration management and regional trend analysis).

projects.name: Strengthening the national response to combat trafficking in persons and smuggling of migrants in Montenegro
projects.description: This initiative aims to strengthen Montenegro’s national response to trafficking in persons and smuggling of migrants by enhancing institutional capacities, fostering multi-sectoral coordination, and utilizing technology to address emerging challenges. It includes capacity-building activities for different responders, development of tool for victim identification, and public awareness campaigns on online recruitment methods and labor exploatation. Additionally, emphasis is placed on improving po

projects.name: Development of capacity building programme for national institutions on Monitoring, Reporting and Verification (MRV) in climate change (mitigation, adaptation, climate finance)
projects.description: As part of Capacity Building Initiative for Transparency, a tailor-made capacity building programme will be developed on methodologies, procedures and guidelines necessary for proper functioning of the national MRV system.

projects.name: System strengthening and support to national institutions and CSOs to provide comprehensive multi-sector protection and support to refugee and migrant children and families,through social and child pr
projects.description: Provision of psychosocial and parenting support services for children and caregivers, provision of non-formal learning and social inclusion activities, programmes with CSOs on provision of  psychosocial support to refugee and migrant children and families, prevention of GBV and violence against children and women,  increased level of knowledge and information about PSEA policies as well as available support services on local and national level and gender based violence  and VaC prevention.

projects.name: Supporting engagement of adolescents and young people, especially from vulnerable groups, in inclusive and high-quality education programs and trainings that build employability skills and support the
projects.description: Support adolescent girls and boys across all three regions of Montenegro to receive career guidance and job training through the “Prilike” programme, which is recognized as a precursor to the EU Youth Guarantee scheme, integrating private-sector partnerships and civil society collaboration to support adolescents in acquiring labour market-relevant skills.
projects.outcome: 2.2. School to work transition and employability

projects.name: Technical and expert support to the Ministry of Justice to secure access to state funded free legal aid scheme for vulnerable persons and group of persons
projects.description: As per the 2011 Law on Free Legal Aid, state funded free legal aid covers a number of court procedures for socially vulnerable persons, but it does not cover judicial procedure for determination of date and place of birth of persons born at home, as well as all administrative procedures, including refugee status determination procedure and statelessness determination procedure. Refugees and persons missing birth registration are among the most vulnerable groups of persons in Montenegro, who ofte
projects.outcome: 4.1. Rule of law and justice for all

projects.name: Technical and policy support to Government programs for strengthening competitiveness of the economy
projects.description: 1. Expert support to the preparation of legal, strategic and policy documents in the field of entrepreneurship, competitiveness, regional development, etc.; 2. Consultancy assistance in the area of strategic planning at the local level;  3. Technical support to the implementation of the Programme for Improving Competitiveness of Economy in Montenegro consisting of several programme lines of financial and non-financial assistance to entrepreneurs and MSMEs;  4. projects.outcome: 1.1.Private sector growth, economic transformation and decent jobs

projects.name: Capacity building of relevant national counterparts and Ministries to develop and implement evidence-based interventions and policies in school settings
projects.description: Implement the Lions Quest Skills for Adolescence Programme, monitor and evaluate its implementation

projects.name: Improve technical knowledge of relevant professionals, including community health workers, on health, early childhood development and parental counselling and support
projects.description: Parenting support programmes and home visitation

projects.name: Support authorities in strengthening synergies between the Basel, Rotterdam, Stockholm and Minamata conventions
projects.description: To overcome the gaps in legislation, institutions, information exchange and multi-sectoral cooperation, with the view to strengthening synergies between the BRS Conventions and the Minamata Convention at the national level, in line with strategic and policy objectives of the Government. This will be carried out through: 1) developing and endorsing chemicals and waste related policy and regulatory documents; 2) implementing capacity building and awareness raising activities to facilitate a synerg
projects.outcome: 1.3 Management of  infrastructure, cultural and natural resources

projects.name: In cooperation with the Ministry of Education, Science and Innovation and other relevant partners and institutions, develop and suport implementation of the Education Reform Strategy (2025 – 2035), wi
projects.description: Technical assistance to the Ministry of Education to develop a multi-year Education Sector Strategy and a budgeted Action Plan, along with social and community mobilization through participatory and inclusive debate on education reform

projects.name: Promote and expand meaningful civic engagement and volunteering opportunities including on climate change, in cooperation with the Ministry of Ecology and other relevant institutions and organizations
projects.description: As part of the Air Quality programme supported by SIDA, UNICEF will be engaging adolescents and young people on air quality and environmental protection issues through educational and entrepreneurial programmes

projects.name: Development of Green House Gas (GHG) Inventory for 2020. and 2021.
projects.description: As part of development of Fourth National Communication and the First Biennial Transparency Report, GHG Inventory for 2020 and 2021 will be developed, serving as an input for defining climate actions with high mitigation potential.

projects.name: Supporting implementation of national Energy Efficiency Programme
projects.description: The Strengthening capacities for increasing energy efficiency in residential sector in Montenegro will focus on building capacities of the Environmental Protection Fund (Eco-Fund) for design and implementation of tailor made and gender-responsive support program for the residential sector that will: a) increase energy efficiency; b) promote the use of environmentally friendly energy sources for heating/cooling; c) promote the use of heating systems with a higher degree of energy efficiency, d) i

projects.name: Diaspora Engagement for the Sustainable Development of Montenegro
projects.description: Activities planned for 2023: Develop a gender sensitive diaspora mapping methodology; conduct an analysis of good practices and recommendations for the development, marketing and management of a diaspora registry. Funding for 2024 to be sought for the following: to strengthen capacities of Montenegro to engage diaspora in socio-economic development; to strengthen environment in Montenegro to harness diaspora's engagement in socio-economic development of Montenegro.

projects.name: National Reform of Disability Determination System
projects.description: The program is expected to deliver the following results: New legal framework and national institutional setting. New national Disability Determination Methodology in line with UN CRPD. E-Register of people with disabilities. New system capacity building.

projects.name: Improved infrastructure and capacities for the implementation of environmental sustainability
projects.description: The project is a joint effort by UNDP and Montenegro’s Ministry of Ecology to strengthen the Ministry’s role in advancing sustainable development and meeting EU Chapter 27 requirements. It promotes environmentally neutral operations, low-emission mobility, and e-mobility within the Ministry, while also enhancing strategic planning and leadership capacities. Through data-driven decision-making, institutional capacity-building, and stakeholder engagement, the project fosters a more coordinated, tr

projects.name: Support to National State Governance
projects.description: The overall objective the Engagement Facility is to support innovative initiatives in strengthening the Office of the President to an institutionalized professional organization with structures and functions appropriate to the Head of State. The Engagement Facility 2023-2027 will be implemented under the Direct Implementation Modality, through an agreed set of initiatives agreed by the Office of the President of Montenegro and UNDP and in line with the committed strategic priorities in the UNDP’

projects.name: Enhancing border control and strengthening capacities to effectively detect and counter the trafficking of drugs and prevent illicit cross-border activities
projects.description: Within the EU-UNODC joint action “Promoting rule of law and good governance through targeted border control measures at land/seaports and airports in South-Eastern Europe (Phase II)” activities aim to strengthen capacities of border control and law enforcement agencies active at airports, seaports and land-border crossings in Montenegro and the region to detect and intercept high risk passengers and goods, in an effort to counter international organized crime and illicit drug trafficking, and pr

projects.name: Support MoE to expand preschool capacity and enhance the quality of care and educational services for all children through workforce development
projects.description: preschool capacity and quality of care and educational services

projects.name: Support to the MSWFCD in development of the new Law on Social and Child protection and advocacy about the harmful effects of child poverty
projects.description: Suboutput in line with EU 2024 Report recommendation under Chapter 19 - Montenegro should adopt the Strategy and Law on social and child protection and start implementing the reform. Development of the Law on Social and Child Protection is prioritized under the EU Accession Programme 2025-2026.

projects.name: Community engagement and empowerment of boys, girls, adolescents and women with knowledge and skills to prevent and report VAC, child marriage, GBV, PSEA and online violence and demand quality victim
projects.description: Support will be provided to CSO and Ombudsperson's office in their community engagement and direct work with children and families, with focus on Roma and Egyptian community aiming to adress and raise awareness on violence, child marriage and exploitation. This will include organization of workshops, social and media engagement and promotional material, including on prevention of sexual exploitation and abuse.
projects.outcome: 4.4 GBV and Violence against women, children and the elderly

projects.name: Creative Montenegro - economic valorisation and creative industries
projects.description: Support the Ministry of Culture and Media and municipalities in a process of economic valorisation of the cultural heritage,  with the special focus on the affirmation of cultural-artistic creativity and further development of creative industries.
projects.outcome: 1.3 Management of  infrastructure, cultural and natural resources

projects.name: Support organization of a high-level European Platform for DRR
projects.description: The overall objective of the sub-output is to support the Government of Montenegro, the Ministry of Interior of Montenegro in delivering the 2024 European and Central Asia Forum for Disaster Risk Reduction organized in Montenegro.

projects.name: Strengthening the responsive capacities of the social and health sectors in support of the COVID-19 response in the country, with a focus on gender equality
projects.description: The project aims to support the country in developing responsive, adaptive, and tailor-made solutions to reduce the vulnerabilities of the most at-risk populations by (1) improving the institutional and policy framework for effective crisis response and post-crisis recovery, (2) enhancing cooperation among institutions, citizens, and the private sector in designing, implementing, and monitoring public services that maximize human development outcomes, and (3) equipping and supporting institution

projects.name: Enabling labor market access to persons under the Law on International and Temporary Protection of Foreigners
projects.description:
In 2024, UNHCR sustained its efforts to facilitate labor market access for individuals under the Law on International and Temporary Protection of Foreigners. A significant advocacy focus was on reducing the waiting period for asylum seekers to gain employment rights from nine months post-application. The authorities have acknowledged the validity of this proposal, and it is anticipated that the legislative framework will be amended accordingly in 2025.
In addition, UNHCR's advocacy led to propos
projects.outcome: 2.2. School to work transition and employability

projects.name: Support refugees' entrepreneurial pursuits through the promotion of thier economic and financial inclusion
projects.description:
A proportionally large number of persons with international and temporary protection in Montenegro are interested in establishing their businesses. This is why UNHCR intensified its efforts to ensure support for their entrepreneurial pursuits.
Namely, in 2024 UNHCR established communication with the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), resulting in their willingness to apply  support program for Ukrainian refugees to Montenegro. This program, which is currently available in o
projects.outcome: 2.2. School to work transition and employability

projects.name: Enhancing digital transformation of education with particular focus on vulnerable groups in line with Strategy for Digitalization of Education (2022 - 2027)(MAF)
projects.description:
The sub-output funded under MAF will focus on the following interventions:
·	Capacity building of teachers on modern didactics for online, offline, and blended learning, including a learner-centred approach, e-pedagogy and special support for the most vulnerable students.

projects.description: The project aims to foster socio-economic empowerment and development of young women and men through efficient and high-quality youth services and programs, as well as support to networking and intersectoral cooperation of relevant actors, both at the local and national levels.

projects.name: Support further development of the local eGovernance system in Montenegro-UNOPS
projects.description:
Objective of this intervention is to contribute to improved quality of life for citizens through increased accountability, transparency, inclusiveness, and efficiency and effectiveness of local public administration.
The key outputs of the intervention will be:
LSGs capacities for eGovernance enhanced 
LSGs ICT resources for e-Governance improved

The project will contribute to the above mentioned outputs with associated sub-outputs and activities that encompass a strategic blend of capacity-bui

projects.name: Better health and well-being for all
projects.description: Country enabled to address social determinants of health across the life course; strengthened capacities to manage NCD risk factor , including support to advance FCTC implementation; support implementation of Protocol on Water and health  and implementation of Minamata Convention.

projects.name: Prevent and combat manifestations of racism, racial discrimination, violence, xenophobia and related intolerance against all refugees and promote an open and evidence-based public dialog on the positi
projects.description:
In 2024, the UNHCR collaborated with both refugee and host communities to prevent instances of racial, national, and other forms of discrimination. Through a series of outreach events with refugee communities, the UNHCR gained a comprehensive understanding of the dynamics between refugees and the host community.
To foster closer relations, the UNHCR organized various sports, leisure, and educational activities, most notably in cooperation with the Football Association of Montenegro and the Olymp

projects.name: Regional Anti-Corruption initiative
Support to the formulation of land policy and piloting land consolidation
projects.description: The objective of this technical assistance is to take the initial steps in introducing land consolidation in Montenegro and implementing land consolidation pilots. The legal review of the draft Law on agricultural land and its subsequent adoption, are prerequisites for the full implementation of the pilot projects. The overall goal is to better align the legal and regulatory framework governing land with the strategic objectives of the Government and enhance the potential of the agricultural sec
projects.outcome: 1.1.Private sector growth, economic transformation and decent jobs

projects.name: Multi-sectoral interventions to Ukrainian refugees in Montenegro focused on humanitarian assistance and preventative measures to address their vulnerabilities
projects.description: Through this action, IOM is delivering multi-sectoral support to Ukrainians affected by the war in Ukraine who have sought refuge in Montenegro. The focus is on providing humanitarian assistance and preventative measures to address their vulnerabilities, with an emphasis on combating human trafficking, through tailored interventions designed to meet their specific needs and challenges.

projects.name: Creating and increasing resilience to (pre-) violent extremism and improved social cohesion, with regard to citizens returning from foreign conflict zones
projects.description: Designed to respond to the needs of Western Balkan governments (Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, North Macedonia, Montenegro, Serbia and Kosovo*) to deal with citizens returning from foreign conflict zones, the project is focused on assisting government authorities to adopt appropriate measures and to develop and implement action plans to provide specialized reintegration, resocialization and rehabilitation assistance tailored to the needs of returnee men, women and children. /MoviEQ ,SMARTY and

projects.name: Promoting gender-responsive justice and security services
projects.description: The initiative focuses on strengthening gender-responsive justice and security services by forming human rights alliances, launching advocacy campaigns, and training diplomats on integrating gender in foreign policy. It aims to empower women in leadership roles within the justice and security sectors through targeted training, developing gender-sensitive guidelines, and raising awareness. Additionally, the project seeks to shape policy on gender equality and the rule of law by conducting communi
projects.outcome: 4.1. Rule of law and justice for all
